content: This clause describes the requirements regarding the management of cybersecurity development activities for a specific project.
Project dependent cybersecurity management includes allocation of responsibilities and planning of cybersecurity activities.
The document defines requirements generically so that they apply to a variety of items and components. Tailoring may be applied based on a defined rationale in the cybersecurity plan.
Tailoring may occur for reuse, component out-of-context, use of an off-the-shelf component, or update.
Reuse of items and components can be a valid development strategy, but modifications or environmental changes can introduce new vulnerabilities.
Changes in known attacks, vulnerabilities, or asset definitions since original development must be considered.
If an original item or component was developed per this document, reuse shall rely on existing work products; otherwise, reuse shall rely on available documentation with justification.
A component may be developed out-of-context based on assumed context and intended use. The supplier defines assumptions and derives cybersecurity requirements accordingly.
An off-the-shelf component is one not developed for a specific customer and used without design or implementation modification.
Such components may still be integrated into an item or component developed per this document, applying reuse analysis and change management as needed.
The cybersecurity case provides the argument supporting cybersecurity assurance and serves as input to cybersecurity assessment and release for post-development.
The cybersecurity assessment independently judges cybersecurity adequacy and supports the release decision for post-development.
The objectives of this clause are to:
a) assign responsibilities regarding the project’s cybersecurity activities;
b) plan cybersecurity activities, including tailored activities;
c) create a cybersecurity case;
d) perform a cybersecurity assessment, if applicable; and
e) decide whether the item or component can be released for post-development from a cybersecurity perspective.
None.
The following information can be considered:
— organizational cybersecurity audit report [WP-05-03];
— project plan.

description: Responsibilities regarding the project’s cybersecurity activities shall be assigned and communicated in accordance with RQ-05-03.
To decide cybersecurity activities needed for an item or component, analyze whether:
a) the item or component is cybersecurity relevant;
b) if cybersecurity relevant, it is a new development or a reuse; and
c) tailoring in accordance with 6.4.3 is applied.
The cybersecurity plan shall include:
a) objective of each activity;
b) dependencies on other activities or information;
c) responsible personnel;
d) required resources;
e) start and end points, and expected duration; and
f) identification of work products to be produced.
Responsibilities for developing, maintaining, and tracking progress of the cybersecurity plan shall be assigned per RQ-05-03 and RQ-05-04.
The cybersecurity plan shall be:
a) referenced in the project plan; or
b) included in the project plan such that cybersecurity activities are clearly distinguishable.
The cybersecurity plan shall specify required cybersecurity activities during concept and product development phases in accordance with Clauses 9, 10, 11, and 15.
The cybersecurity plan shall be updated whenever changes or refinements of activities are identified.
For threat scenarios of risk value 1 determined per 15.8, conformity with 9.5, Clause 10, and Clause 11 may be omitted.
Work products identified in the cybersecurity plan shall be updated and maintained for accuracy until release for post-development.
If cybersecurity activities are distributed, customer and supplier shall each define a cybersecurity plan for their respective activities and interfaces per Clause 7.
The cybersecurity plan shall be under configuration and documentation management per 5.4.4.
Work products identified in the cybersecurity plan shall be subject to configuration, change, requirements, and documentation management per 5.4.4.
A cybersecurity activity may be tailored.
If a cybersecurity activity is tailored, a rationale explaining adequacy and sufficiency to achieve the relevant objectives shall be provided and reviewed.
A reuse analysis shall be carried out if an item or component:
a) has planned modifications;
b) is planned to be reused in another operational environment; or
c) is reused without modification but relevant information has changed.
A reuse analysis shall:
a) identify modifications to the item, component, and operational environment;
b) analyze cybersecurity implications of the modifications including validity of claims and assumptions;
c) identify affected or missing work products; and
d) specify cybersecurity activities required for conformity in the cybersecurity plan.
A reuse analysis of a component shall evaluate whether:
a) the component fulfils allocated cybersecurity requirements in its integration context; and
b) existing documentation sufficiently supports its integration.
Assumptions on intended use and context, including external interfaces, for a component developed out-of-context shall be documented in corresponding work products.
Cybersecurity requirements for out-of-context development shall be based on the assumptions documented in RQ-06-18.
For integration of an out-of-context component, cybersecurity claims and assumptions from RQ-06-18 shall be validated.
When integrating an off-the-shelf component, cybersecurity-relevant documentation shall be gathered and analyzed to determine whether:
a) allocated cybersecurity requirements can be fulfilled;
b) the component suits the intended application context; and
c) existing documentation supports cybersecurity activities.
If existing documentation is insufficient to support integration, cybersecurity activities required to conform with this document shall be identified and performed.
A cybersecurity case shall be created to provide the argument for the cybersecurity of the item or component, supported by work products.
A decision whether to perform a cybersecurity assessment shall be made based on a rationale applying a risk-based approach.
The rationale for performing or omitting a cybersecurity assessment shall be reviewed independently.
The cybersecurity assessment shall judge the cybersecurity of the item or component based on documented evidence.
A person responsible to plan and perform the cybersecurity assessment independently shall be appointed in accordance with RQ-06-01.
A person performing a cybersecurity assessment shall have access to relevant information, tools, and cooperation from personnel performing cybersecurity activities.
A cybersecurity assessment may be based on judgment of whether the objectives of this document are achieved.
The scope of a cybersecurity assessment shall include:
a) the cybersecurity plan and all identified work products;
b) treatment of cybersecurity risks;
c) appropriateness and effectiveness of implemented controls and activities; and
d) rationales demonstrating achievement of the objectives of this document.
A cybersecurity assessment report shall include a recommendation for acceptance, conditional acceptance, or rejection of the cybersecurity of the item or component.
If conditional acceptance is recommended, the cybersecurity assessment report shall include the conditions for acceptance.
The following work products shall be available prior to release for post-development:
a) cybersecurity case [WP-06-02];
b) if applicable, cybersecurity assessment report [WP-06-03];
c) cybersecurity requirements for post-development [WP-10-02].
For release for post-development, the following shall be fulfilled:
a) cybersecurity argument provided by the case is convincing;
b) cybersecurity case confirmed by assessment, if applicable;
c) cybersecurity requirements for post-development phases are accepted.

work_products.description: Cybersecurity plan, resulting from the requirements of 6.4.1 to 6.4.6.
Cybersecurity case, resulting from the requirements of 6.4.7.
Cybersecurity assessment report, if applicable, resulting from the requirements of 6.4.8.
Release for post-development report, resulting from the requirements of 6.4.9.
